verses.verse: Why stand <WH5975> you afar off <WH7350>, O Lord <WH3068>? why hide <WH5956> you yourself in times <WH6256> of trouble <WH6869>?
The wicked <WH7563> in his pride <WH1346> does persecute <WH1814> the poor <WH6041>: let them be taken <WH8610> in the devices <WH4209> that <WH2098> they have imagined <WH2803>.
For the wicked <WH7563> boasts <WH1984> of his heart <WH5315>'s desire <WH8378>, and blesses <WH1288> the covetous <WH1214>, whom the Lord <WH3068> abhors <WH5006>.
The wicked <WH7563>, through the pride <WH1363> of his favor <WH639>, will not seek <WH1875> after God <WH430>: God is not in all his thoughts <WH4209>.
His ways <WH1870> are always <WH6256> perverted <WH2342>; your judgments <WH4941> are far above <WH4791> out of his sight <WH6887>: as for all his enemies, he puffs at them <WH6315>.
He has said <WH559> in his heart <WH3820>, I shall not be moved <WH4131>: for I shall never <WH1755> be in adversity <WH7451>.
His mouth <WH6310> is full <WH4390> of cursing <WH423> and deceit <WH4820> and fraud <WH8496>: under his tongue <WH3956> is mischief <WH5999> and vanity <WH205>.

He sits <WH3427> in the lurking places <WH3993> of the villages <WH2691>: in the secret places <WH4565> does he murder <WH2026> the innocent <WH5355>: his eyes <WH5869> are secretly set <WH6845> against the poor <WH2489>.

He lies in wait <WH693> secretly <WH4565> as a lion <WH738> in his den <WH5520>: he lies in wait <WH693> to catch <WH2414> the poor <WH6041>: he does catch <WH2414> the poor <WH6041>, when he draws <WH4900> him into his net <WH7568>.
He crouches <WH1794>, and bows <WH7817> himself <WH2489>, that the poor may fall <WH5307> by his strong ones <WH6099>.
He has said <WH559> in his heart <WH3820>, God <WH410> has forgotten <WH7911>: he hides <WH5641> his face <WH6440>; he will never <WH5331> see it <WH7200>.
Arise <WH6965>, O Lord <WH3068>; O God <WH410>, lift up <WH5375> your hand <WH3027>: forget <WH7911> not the humble <WH6035>.
Why does the wicked <WH7563> show contempt to <WH5006> God <WH430>? He has said <WH559> in his heart <WH3820>, God will not look at it <WH1875>.

You have seen <WH7200> it <WH5027>; for you behold mischief <WH5999> and spite <WH3708>, to repay <WH5414> it with your hand <WH3027>: the poor <WH2489> commits <WH5800> himself unto you <WH5826>; you are the helper of the fatherless <WH3490>.
Break <WH7665> you the arm <WH2220> of the wicked <WH7563> and the evil <WH7451> man <WH1875>: seek out his wickedness <WH7562> until you find <WH4672> none <WH1077>.
The Lord <WH3068> is King <WH4428> for ever <WH5769> and ever <WH5703>: the heathen <WH1471> are perished <WH6> out of his land <WH776>.
Lord <WH3068>, you have heard <WH8085> the desire <WH8378> of the humble <WH6035>: you will prepare <WH3559> their heart <WH3820>, you will cause your ear <WH241> to hear <WH7181>:
To judge <WH8199> the fatherless <WH3490> and the oppressed <WH1790>, that the man <WH582> of the earth <WH776> may no more <WH3254> oppress <WH6206>.
